text: Rachid Belhout (; June 14, 1944 – August 9, 2020) was an Algerian football manager and player. He managed Al-Ahly Benghazi in the Libyan Premier League.Rachid Belhout, le communicateur ==Carer== In 2005, he was hired as coach of R.E. Virton, who were then playing in the Belgian Second Division. On December 22, 2010, Belhout was made a manager of JS Kabylie.L1 : La JSK renonce à Bouali, Belhout arrive On May 1, 2011, he won the 2010–11 Algerian Cup by beating USM El Harrach 1-0 in the final.Coupe d'Algérie Finale USMH 0-1 JSK On June 26, 2011, Belhout resigned from his position as manager of the club.L1 : Rachid Belhout quitte la JS Kabylie On July 19, 2011, Belhout signed a one-year contract with Tunisian club Union Sportive Monastir.[Officiel] Rachid Belhout nouvel entraîneur de l'USM On February 10, 2012, Belhout signed a one-year contract with Algerian club CS Constantine. ==Death== Belhout died on August 9, 2020, aged 76, after being killed in a car crash near Nancy, France.Football : L’entraîneur Rachid Belhout est mort ==References== ==Other websites== *Rachid Belhout at Footballdatabase Category:1944 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Road accident deaths Category:Algerian footballers Category:Algerian football managers
title: Rachid Belhout
